conclusion: Need to find the time taken for the ball to move from B to C.
Semicylinder with radius R = 0.75 meters placed on horizontal ground.
Point A is the left end of the cylinder, and point B is directly above point A.
Ball is thrown horizontally from point B and grazes past point C on the cylinder.
Angle between OC and horizontal direction is 53 degrees.
This is a projectile motion problem; the ball follows a parabolic path due to gravity.
Horizontal distance from B to C is equal to horizontal distance from A to C.
Set up a coordinate system with point A at the origin (0,0).
Position of point C can be found using angle and radius.
Horizontal coordinate of C is x_C = R * cos(53°), vertical coordinate is y_C = R * sin(53°).
Point C is at (0.45 m, 0.6 m).
Point B is directly above point A, so at height R.
Height from ground to top of cylinder is R = 0.75 m.
Point B is at height R = 0.75 m above the ground.
Ball is thrown horizontally from point B at height R = 0.75 m.
Horizontal position of C is 0.45 m from B.
Vertical distance from B to C is 0.75 - 0.6 = 0.15 m.
